result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander M Mahoney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. If unpaid, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  Payment plan of $100/month to begin on May 20, 2022.

Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If unpaid, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  Payment plan of $100/month beginning on May 20, 2022.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander M Mahoney

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief.

10:47 AM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alexander M Mahoney in court.  Attorney John E. German in court for Alexander M Mahoney. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard. State files an amended information.  Upon plea to Ct. 1 in  the amended information the State would recommend a $500 fine.  Court performs plea colloquy with the defendant.  CC used as a factual basis.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters his plea.  Parties make sentencing arguments.  Defendant speaks on his own behalf.  
Plea:
Ct. 1- GUILTY

BTC:
Ct. 1- GUILTY, $400 FINE, COURT COSTS, DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE.   PAYMENT PLAN OF $100/MONTH BEGINNING ON MAY 20, 2022.
DA Autho to Def re Electronic Evidence

Preliminary hearing on February 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Alexander M Mahoney appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Erin J. Preston appeared by video for Alexander M Mahoney. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
